Description: Baluster sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery dinos stand; exterior: streaky band above black-figure animal frieze to left: part of sphinx or siren with added red on wing and back, and elongated panther (red on neck, rib and rump).
Producer name: Attributed to the Circle of: Sophilos
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.570.b, 1888,0601.570.c, 1888,0601.570.d, 1888,0601.570.g and 1965,0930.759.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 459, no. B776)
Williams 1983 / Sophilos in the British Museum (p. 13, p. 15)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 225, no. 7a)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0276) (Phase 1)
